seo.title: Circularity, Municipal Waste (EU27, technical)
seo.description: Technical page with global filters, aggregations (mean vs. weighted), derived metrics, correlations and formulas (KaTeX). Eurostat (env_wasmun).
h1.title: EU27 Circularity (technical view)
h1.sub: Global filters · simple/weighted average · multiple dimensions · KaTeX formulas · auditable (Eurostat env_wasmun).
kpi.note: Applied to the subset and current year. The mean follows the aggregation mode.
rank.note: Sorted by RCY. Dashed line = mean of the aggregation mode.
pies.h2: 2C) Composition RCY, BIO, INC, LND, Others
pies.note: Top-5, Median and Bottom-5 (by operation/year). Donuts sum 100%.
trend.note: Top-5 (base year) highlighted; EU target (65% RCY) in purple when applicable.
end.note: The smaller the bar, the more circular the system. Purple line: target ≤10% landfill (2035).
comp.note: Each bar sums 100% (RCY, BIO, INC, LND, Others). Ordered by active metric.
sm.note: Annual averages of the subset for RCY, BIO, INC and LND.
trade.note: Each point = country. X: RCY (%); Y: LND+INC (%).
box.note: Min · Q1 · Median · Q3 · Max (current subset).
corr.note: Pearson matrix in the base year (current subset) RCY, BIO, INC, LND, END.
credits.src: Eurostat — Municipal waste by waste management operations (env_wasmun).
credits.lic: CC BY 4.0 in accordance with the Eurostat reuse notice. Logos/brands excluded.
credits.targets: Recycling 65% (Directive (EU) 2018/851) · Landfill ≤10% (Directive (EU) 2018/850). Purple lines represent these targets.
credits.transforms: shares (%), end-of-line (= LND+INC), “Others” (= 100 − RCY − BIO − INC − LND), statistics and correlations as per formulas.
cta.h2: Join us and strengthen your ESG strategy.
cta.p: Follow us and hire services for environmental compliance, ESG reporting and circular management. A technological and sustainable partner for your organization.
modal.title: Formulas & Methodology
modal.1.title: 1) Shares by operation
modal.1.p1: For each country \(g\) and year \(y\), the share of operation \(o\) results from the ratio between the volume of that operation and the total treated volume of municipal waste:
modal.1.p2: If the percentage \(s_{g,y}(o)\) is not provided by Eurostat, it is derived from absolute values \(V\) using the best common unit (priority: PRC > KG_HAB > THS_T > T). “Others” is the residual that completes 100%.
modal.2.title: 2) Simple mean (per country)
modal.2.p1: Each country has the same weight, regardless of population size or waste volume:
modal.3.title: 3) Weighted mean (by annual total volume)
modal.3.p1: Countries with higher waste production have greater weight, ensuring the mean reflects the aggregated whole:
modal.4.title: 4) Derived indicators
modal.4.p1: End-of-line (non-circular destination) and “Others” are calculated as follows:
modal.5.title: 5) Correlation between operations
modal.5.p1: The Pearson correlation matrix is calculated cross-sectionally between countries (subset \(G\)) for the base year:
modal.6.title: 6) Time series and fallback
modal.6.p1: When no share is available for the selected year, a fallback from the time series up to the nearest year is used. This is particularly relevant for “End-of-line”.
n_intro:
Context, sample and active filters. This report describes the circularity of municipal waste in the EU27 in the base year {year}, with {subset_n} countries in the current subset. Filters: operation {op_human}; metric displayed {show_human}; aggregation {agg_label}; countries {subset_n} ({geos_compact}).
See full list of countries{geos_full}
Shares (RCY, BIO, INC, LND) are percentages of the annual total per country; results are presented as {agg_label} mean ({kMean}%), median ({kMed}%) and full distribution.{endNote}
n_1: 1) Average level and within-group variation. The average recycling (RCY) was {kMean}%, with a median of {kMed}%. The Top-3 reached {top3}% on average, while the Bottom-3 did not exceed {bot3}%, highlighting operational and structural heterogeneity.
n_2: 2) Country ranking. In {year}, the best performance was {best_code} ({best_val}%) and the lowest was {worst_code} ({worst_val}%). The gap between extremes shows potential for convergence through quality standards, pp/year metrics and economic instruments (PAYT with social safeguard).
n_3: 3) Composition of the “median country”. The median country {med_code} shows: RCY {med_rcy}%, BIO {med_bio}%, INC {med_inc}%, LND {med_lnd}%, Other {med_outros}%. The combined reading RCY+BIO vs. LND+INC indicates the effective degree of circularity.
n_4: 4) Temporal trajectories. The average rate (OLS) for {op_label} is {slope} pp/year. Positive values suggest convergence with targets; declines may reflect methodological or operational shocks. The Top-5 of the base year tend to show more stable trajectories.
n_5: 5) End-of-line (LND+INC). The subset average is {end_mean}%. Compared to the regulatory target of ≤10% landfill, the average deviation is {gap_aterro_pp} pp (sign “+” = above target). Sustained reductions require prevention, high-frequency BIO and RCY quality to mitigate impurities.
n_6: 6) Structural trade-off. The RCY vs. LND+INC chart shows the expected negative relationship; points to the right/bottom represent more circular systems. The spread indicates multiple efficiency frontiers (urban context, logistics, fraction mix).
n_7: 7) Statistical distribution. Active metric: min {box_min}%, Q1 {box_q1}%, median {box_med}%, Q3 {box_q3}%, max {box_max}%. The IQR supports benchmarking and gradual quartile-based targets.
n_8: 8) Associations between operations. Strongest absolute correlation: {corr_pair}, ρ={corr_val}%. No causal inference; further analyses recommended (fixed effects, regulatory instruments).
n_tail: Implications and next steps. Priorities: (i) scale up BIO with weekly collection and impurity metrics; (ii) RCY quality and contracts with pp/year targets; (iii) economic instruments and circular public procurement. Annual monitoring through slope (pp/year) and normative gaps (e.g., LND ≤10%).
n_end_fallback: Whenever LND+INC is not available in the selected year, a fallback from time series is used; in this subset, year <mark>{end_fallback_year}</mark> had to be used to complete the indicator.
